New Records: Suryakumar Yadav scored 58 runs off 26 balls, a clinical performance.
Riyan Parag took three wickets in eight deliveries, a remarkable display of bowling.
Matheesh Theekshana took four wickets and conceded 40 runs in his spell.
Key Match Events: India set a target of 214 runs and restricted Sri Lanka to 170 all out in 19.2 overs.
Critical dismissals of Kusal Perera and Charith Asalanka by Axar Patel and Arshdeep Singh.
The match finished in the last over with India clinching a 43-run victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Gautam Gambhir and Suryakumar Yadav started their campaign with a 43-run win.
The pitch was expected to be high-scoring with some cracks and slower conditions as the ball ages.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav praised the team's performance and the absence of dew.
Charith Asalanka expressed disappointment with the middle-order batting but highlighted future strategies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Detailed playing XIs with a balance of bowlers and batsmen for India.
The close contest and India's lead in the series after the first match.
